reviews.review: Amazing game with amazing story, the ending will blow your mind, good music, good action, amazing graphics and an enticing story you'll love, Best game I've played so far

Эта игра захватывает дух начиная с самого начала, мы влюбляемся в этих героев и идем по сюжету не зная, чего ещё могли придумать гении из Irrational games и 2K. Сюжет потрясный, нет слов, в жизни не играл ни в одну игру с более глубоким и завораживающим сюжетом. Каждый уровень - какая-то новая локация, каждый уголок хочется исследовать в этой игре. Делал скриншоты практически на кажом шагу. Всем рекомендую эту игру, проходить лучше начинать с самой первой части Bioshock. Такое нельзя пропускать!

I got this game thinking that it would just be some game that I would play once and never play again. This was not the truth. After finishing it the first time my mind was so blown by the genius that was involved in it that I spent about a week not playing it and simply soaking in the mind blowing storyline. I then came back to realize that there was dowloadable content that was on sale. I bought it and began to play Burial at Sea and it was also mind-blowing. I can now find myself re-playing the game and getting as many achevments as poossible.

Pros:
+ Great story
+ Fun gameplay
+ Fun DLC
+ Skyhook is sweet
+ You can explode robot versions of american heros

Cons:
- Your mind may be so blown after finishing this game that you may: lose sleep, stop eating, or find yourself staring blankly at your monitor for hours on end.

Overall: 10/10
Great game obviously some of this reveiw is exagerated, but in short: You will not regret this purchace.

One of the best games which I've played for years (not meaning that I've played them all). Though it's a shooter it has a plot, it has excitement, fun, some cries, some laughs, some head scratching, many wows and a handful of drama.

Recommended not only for the shooting part, but also for music, atmosphere, story (no spoilers here!), characters, mystery, pleasantness, noir staging and of course superb game direction!

BioShock Infinite consegue agradar tanto aos jogadores que buscam apenas um bom FPS quanto aqueles que, além disso, buscam uma boa história. A união desses dois elementos é essencial para a imersão do jogador no decorrer da história.

Belos gráficos, história complexa,trilha sonora impecável, ótima jogabilidade e um final marcante fazem de BioShock Infinite um grande jogo para você adicionar a sua biblioteca de jogos.

這款遊戲偏「恐怖」，敵人會衝過來，轉過頭可能就看到什麼，

尤其是在神經病院的那段更恐怖，請「三思而後玩」。

--

Elizabeth 真的是在戰鬥中的醫療兵，

缺什麼就丟給你什麼，任何小動作都很可愛。

--

遊戲一開始可能什麼都不明瞭，但是到最後才發現，

是一個「無止境」的結局，與遊戲名稱「Infinite」相呼應。

10 分中的 100 分。
The graphics might be breath-taking but what makes this game awesome is the story, which beats many a hollywood script hands down. Definitely recommend it!

Bioshock Infinite takes the stellar and creative gameplay mechanics of the first two installments and makes them more addicting than ever, while it also gives us a well thought out and mind blowing story that not only makes the game all the more satysfying, but also a work of art.

평범한 FPS 게임이 질렸다면, 주저없이 이게임을 선택하라!

1900년대 초반 미국의 시대상을 배경 & 바탕으로 제작된 판타지 이야기. 
파스텔톤 처럼 보이는 동화풍의 배경 색감과 배경음은 게임에 대한 아름다운 착각을 불러일으킨다.

무엇보다 이게임을 강추하는것이 바로 스토리 시나리오
절대 평범하지가 않다.  그냥 해보는게 답!  엔딩을 볼떄쯤이면, 그리고 그것을 제대로 이해했다면, 세상에 이런 이야기를 다 경험하다니~ 하고 느낄정도의 컬쳐 데카르쳐 를 느낄수 있을지도....

Всякий раз, когда кто то хочет заставить другого работать на себя — он взывает к альтруизму. Забудь о том, что нужно тебе, — говорят они. — Думай о том, что нужно кому угодно, только не тебе. Государству, бедным, армии, королю, богу, список бесконечен. Сколько катастроф началось со слов «думай о себе»? Это король и толпа зажгли факел уничтожения, это великий перевёртыш, древняя ложь, которая приковала человечество к бесконечному циклу вины и неудач!

 	— Эндрю Райан

100 METASCORE (MY OPINION)

Great game with a thought-provoking storyline. Unlike in some other games, the companion was a treat to have around, and she ended up saving my life. The only downside, in my opinion, is an annoying boss that you fight three times too many. The DLC is also worth it, and ties the story of this game and the original together. Is gud.

I would definitely recommend this game to people who love FPS games. Control Scheme is nice for the pc (a whole lot better than Bioshock 1). Also, I have a crappy CPU and it still was able to run this game with no lag at 720p. If you own the previous Bioshocks then I'd definitely recommend buying this sequel. All around great game mechanics and nice atmosphere... love the in-game music. 10/10
wiogga

Lets start this review of by saying; I owned Bioshock Infinite on Xbox One and only played it for an hour before putting it back in it's case never to be played again.

So, why did I eventually get it on steam to paly again? Because it was on sale and I thought it would be neat to see if I could mod it a bit like some other games. Turned out there aren't many mods out there, mostly SweetFX.

So, I ran it and put max settings on, and when it loaded for the first time. Man. It almost looked like a whole bew game. The visuals are so ncie to look at that I don't think it even needs a mod.

So, thats the superficial stuff out off the way - what about gameplay and story?
The gameplay is relatively standard with RB-Wep RT-Shoot LB-Choose Ordinance LT-Use Ordinance
But - there are upgrades for both weapons and ordinances(Vigors) - and you can combine them both too, Pretty nifty to have some good combinations going. It feels good to control, and might I add so much smoother than the console. I think the console version may have been 30fps which is why it gelt laggy back then and not as nice. Feels pretty smooth on my PC, and is enjoyable gameplay for sure.

The Story - I don't want to give anything away. Let's just say - it is VERY engaging, has plenty of twists and can make you feel touched at times, if you're a human, at least. If you do not feel touched at one point - you are a robot.
The story is just amazing. I'd say it almost does for FPS what FF7 does for JRPGs.

This will be in my top 20 for a looong time. Must own.

Wow, echt ein tolles Story-based Game. Vom Augenschmaus mal abgesehen hat dieses Game echt eine packende Story.
Ballerszenen mischen sich perfekt dazwischen.
Man fühlt fast mit den Darstellern und am Ende jatte ich sogar Gänsehaut.
Die Spielwelt die im Laufe der Story durchlaufen wird ist sehr detailiert. Es lohnt sich um zu schauen und Dialogen zu lauschen.
Alles in allem ein super jedoch zum Vollpreis sehr teuer, da ca. 12h Gameplay.
Habe es im Sale für 7,50€ gekauft und so war es echt ok :)

Bioshock Infinite besitzt eine der besten Handlung, die man in einem PC Spiel erleben kann. Es gehört zu den eindruckstvollsten Spielen, die man spielen kann, wenn man sich auf das eigenständige und anspruchsvolle Setting einlassen will. Die Handlung ist denkwürdig, und einzigartig. Sie beeindruckt durch glaubwürdige Charaktere und große Tiefe und schafft es den Spieler vor den Bildschirm zu fesseln, emotional zu berühren und zum Nachdenken anzuregen. Bioshock Infinite sollte mehr als nur gespielt werden. Es muss erlebt und gewürdigt werden.
I have just finished the game and it was one of the best things I've ever done in my life. Wow.

Épp most fejeztem be.. Egyenlőre még nem tértem magamhoz a kábulatból.. Ismeritek azt az érzést, amikor befejeztek egy jó könyvet, és miután letettétek nem tudjátok mit kezdjetek az életetekkel? Nos ez a game pont ilyen.. Valami eszméletlen jó története van.. Zseniális.. Jópár éve koptatom már a játékokat, de ilyen intenzitású érzelmi vihart még nem tapasztaltam egyiknél sem..Egyszerűen csak ámultam folyton.. A játékmenet olyan, mint amikor az ember egy jó filmet néz.. Csak pörögnek az események, és múlank az órák, de te ezt észre sem veszed, hisz annyira leköt az egész. Mint már említettem a történet rendkívül tud játszani az ember érzéseivel.. Bevallom voltak részek, amikor majdnem kicsordult a könnyem, aztán hirtelen újra csak kapkodtam az állam, hogy mi is történik.. A grafika szerintem csodálatos.. Bár voltak olyan textúrák, amik kicsit csúnyácskának tűntek, de ze most kit érdekel? A helyszínek zseniálisak, a hangok tökéletesek, a zenék meg.. Pffff.. Arra már jelzőt sem találok...:D Én azt mondom erről kéne példát vennie a többi fejlesztőnek is.. Minek ide 35 fős coop?? Ez kell ide! Egy jó játékmenet, meg egy brutál jó sztori! Kötelező vétel mindenkinek..;)

Fantastic game. The shooting, as always, gets a little repetative, but the story more than makes up for it and keeps you hooked even after the amazing ending.

They say you remember someone from the way they make you feel. BSI certainly gave me many feels during its ending. 

The plot misses the opportunity to develop on some great themes that it establishes (racial exceptionalism, the acceptability of violence as a means to justice, struggle for power) which may leave the world feeling slightly emptier than it could have been. The game also does little to give you (Booker) a reason to hate the antagonist, Comstock, aside from supposed wrongdoings he commits in the name of exceptionalism. Until Comstock personally screws you over (which does happen), you would have to imagine a personal reason to fight Comstock.

Despite the shortcomings of the plot's developments, if one is willing to personally invest oneself and plant oneself in Booker's shoes, one can still find that BSI manages to elicit a good deal of emotions (sort of like playing an RPG and creating a character with a backstory for yourself). While some gripe that the constant addition of new ideas were disorienting (e.g. the sudden revelation that quantum mechanics had a big part to play in BSI), I found myself itching to discover more to answer those question marks.

Another gripe some people have is with Elizabeth. They claim that Elizabeth is nothing more than an ammo/health dispenser and offers little in terms of character development. While Elizabeth's character does fill a well-worn trope, her mechanics in game do make her feel different from the countless hordes of companions in many other games. Most companions are followers: literally in that they often trail behind as you venture forth and figuratively in the way they are most often secondary to the player character. Even in Dragon Age: Origins (which I loved), hailed for its awesome character development, the companions' character does not extend beyond dialogue and in combat you often control their actions (which makes sense for a party based RPG). 

What Elizabeth brings to the table is a companion who feels more human during the actual gameplay. Instead of being a second gun who works independently of you in a gun fight, she augments the player's combat abilities as a support that seemingly has a mind of her own, often providing you with aid when you least expect it (e.g. when you are getting pummeled and have resigned yourself to death). A simple touch of providing her with AI to run in front of you to where you intend to go further strengthens her human-ness. Admittedly, she could do with a more outstanding personality and it would have been great if BSI expanded upon the times she expressed revulsion at Booker's tendency for violence. 

The shooting tends to mellow after a while. Some complain about the dragginess of combat and how long a firefight takes but personally most fights went by relatively quickly for me when utilising headshots with the carbine. Admittedly sticking to the same weapon grows stale and there were little incentive for me to move away from the ammo efficiency and pinpoint deadliness provided by the carbine - aside from trying out the crazier weapons for kicks. Drawn out firefights could have been more interesting if there was gunfire flying everywhere, but hey, this isn't a war simulator. Similarly to firearms, the vigors have a clear hierachy of value and a handful are just simply more useful in straight up combat situations. Nevertheless, the small set of weapons and vigors I found useful were still a blast to use. 

Perhaps it was because of my choice to experience the plot like a traditional RPG, putting myself into Booker's shoes and filling in the details in his character myself. Whatever the case, the ending and its out-of-the blue nature inflicted buckets of feels upon me which persisted for some time (which is hard to elaborate on without spoiling everything). And thus if you decide to take BSI for a ride, I would highly recommend avoiding expecting the game to provide a fully fleshed out character and instead be Booker himself. The Booker that BSI provides is an excellent template and the player doed not need to do much to fill in the blanks. The ride is enjoyable, Columbia is beautiful and you would be missing out on a great experience if you let shortcomings in the plot stop you from seeing the plot at all.

Рекомедную!


        BioShock Infinite является духовным наследником первого BioShock, в этот раз Кен Левин дал нам возможность побывать в летающем городе Колумбия - это красочный и "живой" город , который интересно исследовать. Но наши приключения начнутся с уже знакомого нам места...
        Пару слов скажу о сюжете , он правда гениален и не заставит вас скучать и даже заставит задуматься. И так , наш герой Букер Деввит (детектив) получает задание достать одну девушку, по имени Элизабет , из города Колумбия. Вокруг этих двух героев и будет развиваться сюжет.
        Так же в этой игре затронута религиозная тематика , если вы не ярый фанатик , то эта игра заставит вас задуматься о нашем бытие.
        Геймплей в этой игре весьма забавен и прост , экшена  хватает и самое главное то, что на фоне летающего города все выглядит очень круто.
        По моему это одна из лучших игр 2013 года , я постарался не спойлерить и рекомендую всем ценителям сюжета в играх пройти ее.
